pr_title: CB-5660 Respect declared Role Config Groups in Data Hub template gene…

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be nice to see somewhere what are the configs
timeline.author: doktoric

replies.bodyText: Do you mean a log message?
replies.author: topolyai5

timeline.bodyText: Just a question butmaybe we should use a config json ?
timeline.author: doktoric
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -323,6 +323,8 @@ cb:
     user.role: "ROLE_USER"
     heartbeat.interval: 3
     missed.heartbeat.interval: 30
+    sharedComponents: >
+      HDFS=JOURNALNODE

replies.bodyText: I think it would add unnecessary complexity. Also it would require a rebuild to run with a new config. On the other hand this property can be modified without building a new CB version.
replies.author: attilapalfi92

replies.bodyText: which is easier to update on the deployed version? in app.yml or in a json?
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: I think it is the same. I am just saying that somehow it is not clear what is the key and the value here ?
replies.author: doktoric

replies.bodyText: json is built into the artifact. app.yml properties can be overwritten with env vars.
replies.author: attilapalfi92

replies.bodyText: in cb deployer we have capabilities to override any json which contains config. It is true that we can not do the same on the hosted service but the question here is that do we really need such flexibility ? :)
replies.author: doktoric

replies.bodyText: If we do not want to change on the hosted service, in this case, we do not need to this flexibility.
replies.author: topolyai5

timeline.author: doktoric

timeline.bodyText: Very large if condition. Can you please extract it?
timeline.author: attilapalfi92

replies.bodyText: what is your proposal? I need to check all the three condition in the same if
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: just extract this to a method an name it like areComponentsEqual or something like that
replies.author: attilapalfi92
